intro: Psychotria muelleriana, commonly known as Mueller's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated outside its native habitat.
